results.definition: plan, organize, and carry out (an event)
examples: the neighboring tribe staged an invasion

results.definition: perform (a play), especially on a stage
a specific identifiable position in a continuum or series or especially in a process
examples: at what stage are the social sciences?

results.definition: any distinct time period in a sequence of events
examples: we are in a transitional stage in which many former ideas must be revised or rejected

results.definition: a small platform on a microscope where the specimen is mounted for examination
a section or portion of a journey or course
examples: then we embarked on the second stage of our Caribbean cruise

results.definition: a large coach-and-four formerly used to carry passengers and mail on regular routes between towns
examples: we went out of town together by stage about ten or twelve miles

results.definition: a large platform on which people can stand and can be seen by an audience
examples: he clambered up onto the stage and got the actors to help him into the box

results.definition: any scene regarded as a setting for exhibiting or doing something
examples: it set the stage for peaceful negotiations

results.definition: the theater as a profession (usually `the stage')
examples: an early movie simply showed a long kiss by two actors of the contemporary stage
